Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rotem B
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the center of the city, 10 minute walk from the Ramblas. The room are very nice and big. The Staff is very nice and sympathetic. I RECOMENDED THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk”
Reviews.Author: andrini
Reviews.Content: Miguel was wonderful in helping us get a rental car with Pepe cars, way cheaper than the regular chains. The room was just fine, breakfast lovely, and much to do in the immediate neighborhood. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “An unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: Luis074
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while participating in a conference in Barcelona. The personnel is quite friendly and the hotel is well located, not far from the Paseig de Garcia and Diagonal metro station. But the hotel is quite old and needs to be renovated. On the first day the door lock didn't work well and after a few trials by the porter I had to spend the night with the door unlocked. After some maintenance intervention, on the second day I found myself locked inside the room. After the intervention of the porters, I had to change to another room. In this one the bathroom basin was broken and when I open the door of the bathroom the smell was not what one would expect. It is not a four star hotel, for Barcelona standards, and as I stated before it needs to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kaiolohiakids
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked thru a conference we attended & I was a little leary after reading reviews here. We ended up thinking it was a great place to stay! It was quiet despite being on a busy street, close to the metro & easy walking distance to some of the Gaudi houses, shops & restaurants. The metro was right at the corner. They served a great breakfast every morning and the staff was polite & helpful. The room and bath were roomy & comfortable. I would have no qualms staying here again! Yes, it was a little outdated & the beds were a little hard, but we didn't feel these things were at all detrimental to our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel all round - good rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: liambr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights as part of a package, and was extremely please. Rooms were comfy and quiet with all mod cons and the breakfast was absolutely superb. Staff were helpful and friendly also, spoke impeccable English. Location was great, metro station approximately 30 seconds from the hotel. Would stay there again without doubt

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel - not a four star”
Reviews.Author: MaggisO
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby looks quite elegant and modern, if you like the sterile type. The rooms are small, we were a group and at least two of the rooms didn´t have AC that worked or mini bars that were in function. Bathrooms were not fresh, and the floors were quite old and marked. I also noticed in my room something that looked like blood stain in the bath tub - didn´t want to look too close..... No elevator to the top floor. The hotel is situated quite close to a central metro station wich gives you a good opportunity to get out of the hotel fast....to the places you want to see. Ordinary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sigalsh
Reviews.Content: Gran Hotel Catalonia (or by it's new name Diagonal Centro) pretends to be a four stars hotel while three stars are more appropriate. The breakfast buffet was very poor, and sometimes the food wasn't even fresh. There was a safe deposit in the room but in order to use you should pay 5 euros per day - this kind of service should be free in a 4 stars hotel. In all the four stars hotels I've been at, there were tea bags, coffee, sugar and electric kettle in the rooms - Not in Diagonal Centro. All the TV channels were Spanish, despite of, only, one channel. The room was lovely, the location is great - only five minutes walking to La Ramblas, Garcia and the Diagonal metro station. This was our honey moon and they gave us a double king size bed as we requested. The cleaning service was also very good - every day we entered the room after a long day traveling, we found the room clean and tidy. (Despite the fact that when we checked in the toilette was dirty - but the cleaning stuff came as fast as we informed the receptionist).

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our trip staying here. Lovely staff and location but needs some new features.”
Reviews.Author: zachary78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Gran Catalonia Hotel five days and it was really nice. The staff was so helpful and worried about our thinkings. The only point that we didn't like it is that they need to check the features,the building is quite old.

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointing choice”
Reviews.Author: maria-teogreece
Reviews.Content: First of all the people working there were very rude and even tough we were facing some problems with our stay ,they did not show any interest. The area of the breakfast is terrible. a basement without natural light. The rooms where ok but not appropriate for a 4 star hotel. There was noise also and some characteristic smell. The only good thing ,was that the location is very convinient.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the rumble of the underground trains”
Reviews.Author: sir_travelsalot013
Reviews.Content: The reception was rude. The room was adequate overall but dated. The mattress was hard. The worst part was the vibration and noise from the underground trains passing directly beneath the hotel every 10-15 minutes from early in the morning until late at night. Water pressure was very good in the shower. The windows had nifty electric blinds. The internet was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a real disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: FloppoFlentini
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a birthday trip for my father-in-law. We were a party of eight which included elderly parents and young children. The hotel looked really promising on its website but is actually very shabby. I have been to Barcelona lots of times and love the Eixample district but this hotel is on a grotty street opposite a Cash Converters. The hotel itself is badly in need of updating; the sliding doors had come off our wardrobe and were propped up against the wall for the 3 days we were there. The door next to our room had been kicked in and was hanging off its hinges, as was the door to the toilet downstairs. The staff were surly and disinterested and it took ages to get served at the bar as the barman appeared to also be doing various other jobs. The one positive about this hotel is that the tube station is adjacent and so you can be in the centre of Barcelona very quickly. That is the only good thing about the hotel, however, and I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: johnlh
Reviews.Content: Don't pay to stay here. Lufthansa Airlines put us up in this hotel during the Air Traffic Controller's strike, shame on them. We should have known it was bad when we saw the dirty windows and the not so shiny elevator. You don't see this in Europe, windows are always clean. The hallway looked good. We had trouble getting into our room 614, took several attempts before the key card worked. About the room, the beds were hard; mold on the ceiling around the smoke detector, the bath tub enamel was chipped and rusty and the corner in the bathrooms had built up dirt in them. Avoid this hotel at all cost. One good thing, they have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Room with 3 single beds”
Reviews.Author: OKSooners
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona after a cruise with two of my kids, 20 and 16. We wanted to find a room which would accomodate three people. This was the only one I could find. It was very clean, with wood floors and a nice bathroom. The price was reasonable ($159 Euros) and the men at the front desk were helpful and spoke English. Within walking distance of a great restaurant, Botofumeria.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyIndia
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is good, rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Take the rooms which face the road - there is more to watch and these have a balcony. Rooms behind the hotel overlook other drab houses. Unfortunately, though comfortable, this hotel is located a bit far from all attractions and restaurants. Hence I would not recommend it for tourists. If your are a tourist, it is better to stay at a hotel closer to La Rambla. This place is ok for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “They know and perform their business well”
Reviews.Author: CairoSam
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced at the hotel was more than what we expected, from the moment we arrived, the welcome smile and having every thing ready for the group helped my life a lot being the tour leader. The rooms allocated to each guest were very satisfaying and the room size was good, clean and had all the faciity and comfort. The hotel location was very good , with the underground station being aroung the corner from the hotel , and you can walk to the shopping places very easy. not to mention the shops around the hotel area. The food offered at the hotel were very testy and great. Our only recommendation for next time is to find the coffee and tea with the electric kettle in the room. Would very much recommend this hotel and if I wil visit Barcelona again will stay there once more. Say what you liked best & least

Reviews.Title: “when I return to Spain, this is the hotel we shall choose.”
Reviews.Author: bond911
Reviews.Content: My warm recommendation to the Gran Hotel Catalonia In all aspects of its operation : friendly, polite, and great help in all our needs. The room was always clean, breakfast always full and varied, and the reception staff was helpful for all our requirements. Your 4 stars are well deserved. If and when I return to Spain, this is the hotel we shall choose.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear”
Reviews.Author: MrTrip-along
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located although the decor is basic and a bit tired and there are no 4 stars facilities (no swimming pool, no gym, rooms are average size, mattresses are beaten up, no English speaking television channels etc.). However, I ended up in a small sweltering room facing the garage and with malfunctioning air conditioning. Like other customers I protested several times and asked to change room but I was told that the hotel was fully booked. Some of the staff tried to be helpful and corteous but they also told me that the air con has been working poorly for a long time but nothing has been done. I spent four miserable nights dreaming to be in the perfecly refrigerated metro instead of my room. Stay clear of this hotel or, at least, check the wather forecasts before going!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for that price”
Reviews.Author: Roni29
Reviews.Content: Advantages: Spacious and clean rooms and bathroom, polite and helpful staff, in the middle of Exaimple area (good shopping and cafes), very close to metro stations (Provenca and Diagonal), wireless internet Disadvantages: basic breakfast, not very central (far from La Rambla)

Reviews.Title: “Great, roomy hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ahp10
Reviews.Content: The Gran Hotel Catalonia was referred by the travel center in Barcelona. It was great. The room was large, quiet and clean. The bathroom, also large, had good water pressure. The staff was friendly. The hotel charged for breakfast and a safe, so we avoided both. The location was perfect. The hotel is a few blocks from the Gaudi buildings and a half-clock for the very good subway. We would happily stay here again should we return to Barcelona. All-in-all, this hotel is a find!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and close to some attractions. Good in summer.”
Reviews.Author: pige_paa_ferie
Reviews.Content: I paid about 50EUR per night for a single room in the late summer. The hotel looks like something from the 80s from its entrance. The lobby staff was friendly. I got a very small tiny room at the back of the building. The room was clean and modern. Not much sunlight but I didn't spend too much time in the room so this was OK. I even booked the flamenco and dinner event through them. Right outside the hotel and on close-by streets there are cafés and restaurants to eat. The location is within walking distance to Gaudi's La Pedrera and Casa Battlo and if the weather permits, the walk to la rambla is also very pleasant (takes about 20 minutes). Recommended for solo or young traveller's who need a decent place to spend the nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Avra_air
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Gran Hotel is a mediocre hotel that is convenient in terms of location as it is next to the metro, but as facilities and decoration probably needs a restoration. I guess it is ok if you just want a decent place to sleep at night. Rooms are cleaned every day (the house keeper has a personal taste on the way your personal belongings should be placed - but I should mention that nothing was missing after that), the breakfast was very good and the rooms were not small, but of a reasonable size. But again Barcelona is so beautiful that you will leave the place feeling happy and content!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice / clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate345
Reviews.Content: My partner and I where relocated to this hotel from the Catalonia Princessa because of flooding. Whilst this hotel was further away from the Las Ramblas, this was not a problem because it was only a 25 minute walk (lots of posh shops on the way) and there is a metro station right outside the hotel. The hotel in its self was nice and very clean, the rooms were on the small side but both the room and bathroom was nice. Even though we had an interior room, it was very noisy and not very well insulated. The breakfast was lovely, lots of pastries, cheeses etc, they even had chocolate cake if you can stomach it at that time in a morning! Not much choice if you like a cooked breakfast though but this may have been because it was 10.00 am and the breakfast finishes at 10.30 am. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and all in all a nice hotel. This hotel is right next to the Diagonal so is ideal if you are a shopaholic and don't mind using the metro!

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Diagonal Centro
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Balmes, 142-146, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
